str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Unworthily, in an unworthy manner. Adverb from anaxios; irreverently.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Involved in, held in, hence: liable, generally with dat. (or gen.) of the punishment. From enecho; liable to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
